Description: Initiates 'Safer at Home' statewide on 4/27 with limited economic reopening under health safeguards.
Primary Mobility Impact: Continues stay-at-home posture, dampening rebound in commuting and discretionary travel.

Description: Moves statewide into 'Safe Return' allowing more sectors to open with capacity and mitigation rules.
Primary Mobility Impact: Commuting/consumer trips resumed gradually; event-driven mobility still constrained.

Description: First wave of county mask orders with added business limitations, later expanded to more counties.
Primary Mobility Impact: Raises protection for indoor/commercial travel in hot-spot counties, reducing close-contact risk.

Description: Statewide face covering requirement starting 8/5; delays in-person start for grades 7–12 in eight counties.
Primary Mobility Impact: Uniform mitigation in public/transit settings; slows full resumption of school commuting.

Description: Ends statewide mandate while keeping limits where distancing not possible (e.g., 20 indoor/100 outdoor).
Primary Mobility Impact: Shifts from statewide to localized control; event/leisure mobility still limited by size caps.

Description: Reimposes mask rules in 9 counties (10/21) and adds 7 more (10/27), adjusted as conditions change.
Primary Mobility Impact: Tightens indoor activity risk in fall surge hot spots; curbs cross-county event travel.

Description: Multiple waves broaden coverage; by 12/11, mask mandates cover 61 counties with stricter gathering caps.
Primary Mobility Impact: Suppresses large gatherings and cross-area movement during winter resurgence.
